results.reasoning: The screenshot shows a banner component in its default state with placeholder content. The component displays 'OPZNTUI' (which appears to be a stylized logo/heading) and the subtitle text 'What will you build?' on a black background. This matches the expected outcome of a default state with placeholder children. The text content is present and readable, forming a typical banner/hero section pattern. Given the lenient strictness and that we're only checking text (not layout or colors), this implementation passes the test.

observations.layoutDescription: The banner occupies the full viewport with centered content. The main heading is positioned in the upper-middle area with large, bold, pixelated-style white text. Below it is a smaller subtitle in gray text. Both elements are horizontally centered on the black background.

suggestions: Consider adding aria-label or role attributes for better accessibility
Ensure the banner has appropriate semantic HTML structure (e.g., <header> or <section> with heading hierarchy)
If this is a reusable component, verify that custom placeholder content can be easily injected
Consider adding test IDs or data attributes for easier automated testing
